mainTopic.title: Alimentary canal organs
mainTopic.content_info: The content includes both anatomical and physiological information, however in each subtopic we only need the anatomical information to be turned into revision questions

quizzes.question: What is the structural composition of the hard and soft palate in the mouth?
quizzes.goodAnswer: The hard palate is made of bone, while the soft palate is made of skeletal muscle.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Both the hard and soft palate are made of bone.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: The hard palate is muscle, while the soft palate is bone.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: The hard palate is cartilage, while the soft palate is muscle.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Both the hard and soft palate are made of cartilage.

quizzes.question: Which type of papillae on the tongue contain taste buds?
What are the anatomical regions of the pharynx involved in the digestive process?
How does the esophagus connect to the stomach?
What are the four main regions of the stomach?
Which structure increases the absorptive surface area in the small intestines?
What is the main function of the large intestine?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Absorption of water and formation of feces.
